posts.title: Handmade bomber jacket I made using recycled fabrics
posts.postDrescription: Handmade bomber jacket I made using recycled fabrics.The pattern was made from a self drafted pattern I made based off of a mens large bodice block I got from the school I went to (blanche macdonald). I was inspired by vintage military bomber jackets. The body fabric is wool with a cotton lining. All the fabrics are soured second hand, as well as the zipper and ribbing

posts.title: My solopreneur story
posts.postDrescription: My entrepreneurship journey started in 2016 when I believed I was Mark Zuckerberg. It took 2 years to make my first $1 online. Later, I grew a SaaS to $3,000 MRR, but I started to see my journey as a failure after 4 years of grind. I got depressed in 2021 and quit entrepreneurship. I worked for Tai Lopez as a product manager to overcome my depression. It worked because I finally had a sense of purpose. When I got fired in November 2021, it didn’t matter. I had a dream. I discovered my role models on Twitter: Pieter Levels, Danny Postma, and other cool kids working solo on their projects from anywhere in the world, making much more money than needed to live comfortably. I wanted freedom. I was living in Bali, $20,000 in the bank, no audience, and bad coding skills.

posts.title: “Downturns are moments of opportunity” summing up My 3 years commitment
posts.postDrescription: What started as a means to control my bad spending habits has now grown into my most prized possession as I finally get my best return with fund hitting all time high. I started my market journey in April 2022, just before a big crash in the market. I kept thinking how stupid I was. At least I could have bought those sneakers rather than losing money for nothing. But one lesson I learnt was “Don’t get too greedy and don’t get too scared” and kept it going.

posts.title: I wrote a paper called 'European Political Interest in the Middle East'
posts.postDrescription: Today, I delved into the complex landscape of European political interest in the Middle East and penned my thoughts in a paper.  Exploring the intricacies of international relations and the dynamics shaping the region was a fascinating journey.

posts.title: Published First Book
posts.postDrescription: Thrilled to share that I've published my first book! This journey of creativity, perseverance, and storytelling has been incredibly rewarding. Here's to many more chapters and adventures in the world of writing.

posts.title: Celebrating a Three-Month Yoga Journey - A Personal Achievement Unlocked
posts.postDrescription: Hey All!! Today is a special day as it marks a significant milestone in my wellness journey – Celebrating three months of dedicated yoga practice today! From mastering poses to discovering the mind-body connection, this journey has transformed me. Yoga enhances flexibility, strength, and mental resilience. Excited to share this milestone and invite you to celebrate the holistic well-being achieved through this ancient practice. Here's to health, balance, and the ongoing journey to our best selves!

posts.title: I cooked Biriyani at my kitchen today
posts.postDrescription: After having a delicious biriyani at a dinner with my Indian friend some days ago, I was determined to learn the art of making it. Today, I finally did it, and the biriyani looks amazing!

posts.title: finished my first ever ultra marathon (51 km)
posts.postDrescription: Alhamdulillah. Many many  thanks to my ALMIGHTY ❤ I have finished my first ever ultra marathon (51 km) strongly without any muscle fatigue  And now I am good in physically

posts.title: My Journey of Career Transformation
posts.postDrescription: This year was a turning point in my career as a 37-year-old mother of two who is well-versed in sales and marketing and possesses a wide range of soft skills. Having made up my mind to learn programming in particular, I decided to focus on Python and started the '100 Days of Code' course on Udemy. The drawback? With my family and a full-time job to balance, I could only dedicate 20 to 30 minutes a day to my online coursework. Day 1 and Day 2 took me about three weeks to complete, which is a monument to my perseverance in the face of difficulty. The reality check arrived quickly, as doubters questioned if it was possible to succeed in programming in such a short amount of time. However, I'm looking for inspiration from you all. Are there other people who, like me, are juggling a lot of duties while yet daring to hope for a career in coding? My ambition is to use my newly acquired talents to earn a part-time income in the future as I persevere through the 100 Days of Code. Though the journey may take longer than the customary 100 days, every line of code represents an achievement. Talk about your experiences and insights, and together, let's build a community that encourages dreamers like us. I am delighted to share my motivation and progress as a programmer

posts.title: Launched My First Mobile App
posts.postDrescription: After months of coding and testing, I finally launched my first mobile app! It's a productivity tool to help users stay organized. Excited to see it in action!

posts.title: Delicious Homemade Pasta
posts.postDrescription: Just made my own homemade pasta from scratch for the first time! Used a traditional recipe with flour and eggs. The result was amazing. Can't believe I made it myself!

posts.title: I build my first desk, and I am really proud ...
posts.postDrescription: Finally built my first desk, blending oak and ebonized-oak for a classic, upscale vibe. It's been a learning curve; some parts were a breeze, others not so much. But it's standing, looks decent, and no lost fingers—win-win, right? If you're into the DIY scene or curious about the process, check out my journey on Instagram @vinticiousberlin. I've documented it all in a series of videos. Feel free to shoot me any questions or if you're up for a project collaboration. Building this desk has been a fulfilling experience, and I'm eager to share the details with fellow enthusiasts!

posts.title: I overcome my public speaking fear
posts.postDrescription: Just wanted to share a little victory on my journey. Public speaking used to give me major butterflies, but recently, it kicked it up a notch with nausea vibes.  But here's the cool part  I decided to face it head-on! Deep breaths, mindful moments, and a sprinkle of visualization turned my fear into a strength. From small settings to bigger stages, I conquered them all.  Big shoutout to my awesome supervisor for having my back and the pros who gave me game-changing strategies. The stage that once felt like a battlefield is now my playground. Moral of the story: You can turn your challenges into triumphs. Don't be shy to share your struggles and seek support. You got this!

posts.title: Embarking on a New Journey: Launching 'EcoTech Innovations'
posts.postDrescription: Exciting News! Today marks the beginning of a new chapter as I officially launch my startup, 'EcoTech Innovations.' The journey from ideation to execution has been an exhilarating adventure, and I'm thrilled to share the vision behind this endeavor.

posts.title: Solo travel in Istanbul
posts.postDrescription: Recently explored Istanbul solo, and what an adventure! Navigating markets, befriending travelers, and following the aroma of baklava led me through a maze of experiences. Impromptu dance parties, attempting Turkish, and mastering vague sign language—universal communication, right? Solo travel isn't just about new places; it's self-discovery. Istanbul taught me that the best stories emerge outside comfort zones. Here's to more adventures, laughter, and the bliss of baklava-induced moments!

posts.title: Completing 30 days of Yoga!
posts.postDrescription: I did the 30 yoga challenge today! I have to say it came with a lot of benefits! I got some flexibility, there is a bit more definition in my abdomen. I think I'm handelling anxiety better. I will continue doing it daily through February since feel like I am getting fitter and lost twelve Ibs. I am adding arm exercises to try and help my upper body strength. My goal is to get to ten full push-ups by the end of the year which feels attainable with more work. Excited for the next 30 days!

posts.title: How Data Science is Shaping Our Digital Landscape
posts.postDrescription: Researching and exploring the data-driven revolution with the powerful impact of Data Science on our digital world. From predictive analytics to uncovering hidden patterns, data scientists are reshaping industries. Join us on a journey through the realm of big data, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, as we unravel the mysteries behind the algorithms driving innovation and decision-making in today's dynamic digital landscape.

posts.title: AI's Revolutionary Leap in Healthcare
posts.postDrescription: As i am exploring in the field of technology, join me in this journey and lets dive into the cutting-edge world of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the medical field. Witness the transformative power of AI algorithms in diagnostics, personalized treatment plans, and patient care. From machine learning-driven predictions to image recognition enhancing medical imaging, the future of healthcare is being redefined. Stay tuned for a closer look at how AI is becoming an indispensable partner in the quest for improved medical outcomes and patient well-being.

posts.title: I have completed my 62 Day streak of my journey to learn German from duolingo
posts.postDrescription: Must say this has helped me a lot in my day to day conversations at market places, restaurants etc. Was quite surprised to see myself order “ Half chicken for take away, please cut it into 2 pieces ” by saying “Halbes Hähnchen zum Mitnehmen, bitte schneiden zwei Stücke ” Though I might not be grammatically correct, I definitely managed to convey my message. Would totally recommend duolingo to people wanting to learn a new language for casual conversations.

posts.title: I have fulfilled my first yearly target
posts.postDrescription: Completed my first full marathon, covering 42.2KM—a goal I didn't think possible just six months ago. This endurance test was the toughest in my life, but the feeling afterward was incredible! Considering an Ironman 70.3 next. Background: Not a runner, but after a 7.5KM mini marathon last March, I got hooked. Tested endurance, prioritized health, joined a supportive community, improved stamina, and started collecting medals. Running with friends and family became a mini adventure. For those still reading, I invite you to try a mini marathon—test it yourself and see if it becomes your thing too!

posts.title: Pottery Adventures with My Best Friend!
posts.postDrescription: Spent the day at a pottery class with my bestie, and it was an absolute blast! From shaping clay to creating unique pieces, we learned so much and had a ton of fun.

posts.title: Story of my start-up buisness in this competative food market
posts.postDrescription: In the span of a year, my food business journey has been a rollercoaster of challenges and triumphs. Driven by a passion for culinary arts, I navigated industry complexities, conducting extensive market research to understand preferences and market gaps. With a solid business plan, I tackled logistical hurdles, sourced quality ingredients, and built relationships with suppliers. Establishing an online presence through social media and a user-friendly website expanded outreach. Customer feedback refined the menu, and collaborations with local events boosted brand visibility. Despite challenges, the first year marked significant growth, emphasizing adaptability, resilience, and genuine passion in the demanding world of food entrepreneurship.

posts.title: Champion of Bremen Prenier League(BPL)
posts.postDrescription: 'Back-to-Back champion' of Bremen Premier League (BPL) - (2023-2022) Luisental Rocks -(2023) Bremen Vikings - (2022)

posts.title: Embracing Uncomfortable Adventures
posts.postDrescription: Stepped out of my comfort zone big time tonight! Summoned all my courage, walked up to a group of strangers at the bar, and asked if I could join them. To my surprise, they welcomed me with open arms, and what followed was an unforgettable night of laughter, new friendships, and unexpected adventures. Turns out, the best memories are often found on the other side of discomfort. Here's to taking risks, making connections, and embracing the unknown!

posts.title: Published Research Paper in Renewable Energy
posts.postDrescription: Exciting News! Thrilled to share that my research paper in the field of renewable energy has been officially published! This journey has been a culmination of tireless efforts, countless hours in the lab, and an unwavering passion for sustainable solutions. Today, I want to take you behind the scenes of this scientific exploration and share the significance of the findings.

posts.title: My pizza reciepe for dinner
posts.postDrescription: Tonight's dinner was a delightful journey into the world of homemade pizza. Starting with a classic pizza dough recipe, I kneaded the soft and elastic dough, allowing it to rise to perfection. The kitchen was soon filled with the irresistible aroma of tomato sauce simmering on the stove, enriched with herbs and spices for that authentic flavor. Assembling the pizza became a creative process, spreading the sauce over the dough and generously layering it with a blend of mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses. Toppings ranging from pepperoni to colorful bell peppers added a burst of flavors and textures. The oven transformed my culinary creation into a golden, bubbling masterpiece. The final result was a crisp, yet tender, crust supporting a medley of savory ingredients—a homemade pizza that not only satisfied my craving but also provided a sense of accomplishment and the joy of sharing a delicious meal with loved ones.

posts.title: Cracked the Code!
posts.postDrescription: Just had a mini victory in my coding journey and I couldn't be more stoked! After hours of head-scratching and debugging, I finally cracked that pesky bug in my code. It might seem like a small win in the grand scheme of things, but hey, progress is progress, right? Here's to embracing the challenges, celebrating the victories, and geeking out over lines of code like a boss!

posts.title: One of the cutest mammals I came across in the jungles
posts.postDrescription: One of the cutest mammals I came across in the jungles of Costa Rica! the Mexican mouse opossum. This species reaction to lights is not to run but to freeze, making it really easy for a quick shot.

posts.title: learned JavaScript and Created a Fun Project: Tic Tac Toe!
posts.postDrescription: After months of dedication and learning, I'm thrilled to share that I've learned JavaScript.  Today, I completed my latest project: a dynamic Tic Tac Toe game!  It was a challenging yet rewarding journey, and I'm proud of the results.  Thanks to everyone who supported me along the way!  Check out the project and let me know your thoughts.  #JavaScriptJourney #TicTacToeProject #CodingAdventure

posts.title: The Transformative Power of Daily Meditation
posts.postDrescription: Hey everyone!  Sharing a personal transformation journey with you – my daily meditation practice. Each day, I intentionally carve out time for quiet reflection and mindfulness, and the impact has been remarkable. From heightened focus and mental clarity to an overwhelming sense of peace, meditation has become my daily anchor. It's more than a routine; it's a profound shift in my daily life. Let's explore this transformative journey together, discovering the power of stillness and mindfulness that brings positive changes to our lives.
